name: Asian Turkey Meatballs
author: Reesa's Fab Kitchen online
summary: These Asian turkey meatballs are so good for an appetizer. People love them!
ingredients: 2 slices fresh ginger, or more to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Combine turkey, cilantro, bread crumbs, egg, scallions, vegetable oil, sesame oil, and soy sauce in a large bowl
Gently mix with your hands until combined
Roll tablespoon-sized scoops between your palms to form meatballs
Arrange meatballs on the prepared baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until well browned, 20 to 25 minutes
Smash ginger with the heavy side of a knife and place in a small pot
Add brown sugar, soy sauce, rice vinegar
Stir over medium-low until sugar dissolves, about 3 minutes
Simmer, stirring frequently, until slightly thickened, about 3 minutes
Fish out ginger and divide sauce among small cups
Serve meatballs alongside sauce, with toothpicks for dipping
